intro: Ulmarronia mariquitensis, commonly known as the Mariquitensis ulmarronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
